reviewText: See the Original (over 100 chapter series) instead of buying this overly dense, tightly cropped cut and paste job of a DVD. Why is do I recommend the Original? Because key characters and parts of the story are missing and the DVD makes little to no sense as a result.
Item arrived on time and as described, very pleased with the seller and the item.

Another Tai Seng re-edit from a joint HongKong Taiwan China and Singapore produced manga style sword and sorcery drama series.
Unlike other Tai Seng releases, the re-editing is pretty poor resulting in a rather incoherent and confusing film with unexplained plot changes.

Action choreography is good in parts but as this is a manga style sword and sorcery tv series one must expect some low budget special effects.

Still better than a 70s or 80s one dimensional old skool Hong Kong or Taiwan martial arts flick but if you want substance then wait with bated breath or petition Tai Seng to release the full 30 episode drama series with English Subs. I understand that the series garnered pretty good reviews in Hong Kong and Southeast Asia when first aired on local TV.

This is NOT the Shaw Brothers movie "Buddha's Palm (1982)".  This film has nothing to do with that version.

Plot: When the long lost "Buddha's Palm" manual resurfaces for the first time in 300 years, fighters from all corners vow to learn the stance and become leader of the martial arts world. But only one man has the power to use it against the evil Fire Demon!

Cast:  Julian Cheung Chi-Lam  ||  Athena Chu Yun  ||  Christopher Lee Ming-Shun

Running Time: 180 mins. (approx.)

Distributor: Tai Seng  [A USA/Hong Kong-Based Distributor]

from Robert A Beattie on June 13, 2017 Realistic Supernatural martial arts film great fun Great surreal Supernatural special effects martial arts film with so many intriguing different characters. At one point a lightsaber comes into play Golden Dragon Dagger to fight off a group of musicians who were using their music in an evil enchanting way. Also a character whose leg stretches out for many feet to attack and kick. Also there is swastikas in this film. Even if you look up in the Holocaust Museum information and explain that this goes back possibly twelve thousand years meaning good fortune? Not the perverted Nazi Symbol.

Good silly fun. Tricks were meant to be unbelievable & quite funny. Even though the english rolled by so fast, I used computer keyboard to pause when needed. I very much enjoyed this film. Hard to find these kinds of fun films these days. This movie to me is rated General Fun.
This Shaw Brothers classic is downright bonkers. I had an absolute blast watching this and I'm already thinking about a repeat viewing with some friends.
Loved it. A tad silly but hey. It's still a classic
One of the better Shaw Brothers' offerings. Great action scenes, and some cheesy 1970s style animation/special effects. Definitely worth your while if you are a Shaw Brothers fan.

Shaw brothers doing what they do best, ENTERTAINING! Their Wuxia (similar to medieval heroes/swords and sorcery) comedy is something you can watch with your teens and everyone can enjoy. it is light and playful not the normal hardcore Chinese opera. Crazy weapons, mystical martial art styles and an easy to follow plot with a little twist make this a winner if you are looking for something fun to watch.
Ummmmm No!  I like a little cheese in my movies but this one was a bit too much.
